intro: Trichodesma calycosum var. formosanum, commonly known as the Formosan trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in open woodland or disturbed soils. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
